intro: Empogona crepiniana, commonly known as the sour fig or wild fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into edible, fleshy fruits. The fruit is typically sour and contains a single seed, making it a characteristic feature of the species. It is often found in moist, shady habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
